dialogues.text: Pulitzer walks with stiff dignity to the window; from below, the FAINT CHANTING floats seems deafening to his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we can resolve our... small differences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David digs out their demands and prepares to read. GOLDENROD 4/12/91                                    113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Race, Boots, Les, etc. unpacking rotten fruit, getting ready for action. They see several police moving into the square -- including a paddy wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta warn Jack -- ! The others nod agreement -- but where is he?   Then they see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Weasel and the line of goons Jack and David are approaching, beaming in triumph. Seitz is with them. Les quickly slips through the bars, running to tell Jack -- but Weasel grabs him, shoves him back roughly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack -- !   Jack -- ! Weasel, surprised, sees Jack behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how he got in here, Mr. Seitz -- but I'll take care of him, with pleasure. Just say the word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With pleasure. You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again...? A tomato hits him in the face; he turns to see Les wiping tomato juice off his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said, you're fired. Triumphant, Jack hoists Les over his shoulders:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strike's over -- we beat 'em!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A huge roar goes up outside the gates -- they swing open and the Newsies swarm in, engulfing Weasel and the Delanceys -- trying to look like part of the gang -- as they rush to mob Jack and David. Jack spots Sarah -- she's waving and pointing in alarm at something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembers) The bulls! Jack -- the bulls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sees several police shoving through the crowd toward him. He quickly deposits Les -- turns to run and sees -- -- Snyder right in front of him, hands behind his back. Jack spins away and right into the arms of -- MacSWAIN Easy, lad! You don't have to run anymore -- not from the likes of him anyway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks again and sees Snyder's hands are handcuffed behind him; two cops have him in custody. Denton is there, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We brought the Warden over to say goodbye. Goodbye, Warden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches, amazed, uncomprehending,    as the cops mov Snyder to the paddy wagon. As the rear     doors are open several boys pile out -- former inmates    of the Refuge, including Tenpin. As Snyder is loaded     in, the last bo is coming out, crutch first --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Snyder) Remember what I told ya -- first t'ing ya do in jail, you make friends with the rats, share what you got in common -- (sees Jack) Hiya, Jack! My leg tells me the strike's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Crutchy -- I don't get it.   What happened -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya orta seen it, Jack -- he came chargin' into the Refuge wavin' his walkin' stick like a sword and he's leadin' this army of lawyers and cops and Snyder's hidin' in the patata bin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talkin' about -- who come chargin' in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?   Your pal! Him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points O.S. -- Jack turns to see --

dialogues.speaker: ELEGANT COACH
dialogues.text: parked across the square. A Rough Rider opens the door and a man leans forward -- a glimpse of silk hat and walrus mustache as Teddy Roosevelt raises his walking stick in salute to Jack across the square.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Jack is awestruck; so are the other Newsies gathering around. Denton moves up to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Governor Roosevelt's very grateful that this problem was brought to his attention. He'd like to offer you a lift, anywhere you like. This time, you ride inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at the coach, torn. Boots holds the bundle of belongings he gave him earlier. Suddenly Jack decides, snaps his fingers, Boots tosses him the bundle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he could drop me at the train yards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denton moves off toward the coach. David, Sarah, Les look stunned, dismayed -- Jack avoids their eyes. Behind them, the BELL RINGS, the circulation window opens for business -- a crowd of Newsies races to line up. The gang looks at them hungrily, eager to return the work. They look at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really goin' this time...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now or never, Racetrack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't be the same without ya. Give ya even odds on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes; the others crowd around. David looks on, left out for the moment; Sarah and Les beside him.

dialogues.speaker: KID BLINK
dialogues.text: See ya in the funny papes, cowboy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Blink, keep ya eye peeled.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTS
dialogues.text: We heard it. (offering marbles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My best shooters. Never know when ya need good shooters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wanna alarm ya, Jack, but what I hear, out West ain't like New York at all -- it's fulla bulls, for one t'ing -- not cops, neither, but big ugly animals with horns and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugs him) I'll miss ya, Crutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crutchy hobbles off to the dock. Jack looks off at the waiting coach, then holds out his hand to Les, who runs up and clings to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't no good at writin' and stuff but... I'll be thinkin' of ya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to run away anymore, Jack. You have a choice now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won today, but the fight's not over. You're needed, Jack. We need you. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, looking at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's what scares me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the emotions are too much for him -- he turns, runs across the square, not looking back, racing towards the coach. Les starts after him -- David catches him, holds him, as he and Sarah watch -- -- Jack climbing into the coach, greeted by Teddy. door closes, the coach trots away. "SANTA FE" is underscored. As the coach moves off, the Newsies move up, waving their caps goodbye. David and Sarah watch, feeling a great loss; Les is crushed. The Newsies move into the court- yard, trying to keep their spirits up as:

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC BEGINS
dialogues.text: 3:00 The Newsies sing as they                        MUSH line up, trying to keep            TRY BOTTLE ALLEY OR TH their spirits up.                    HARBOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sing as they wait for papers, but something's missing...                 NEWSIES a voice, a presence, a        IT'S A FINE LIFE, spirit -- and then --         CARRYIN' THE BANNER... (ETC -- Jack leaps onto the dock and rings the bell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it, Les!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comin' down the chute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The papers slide down the chute; Jack moves to the front of the line grinning -- seeing Sarah smiling at him from the gates. Jack sings   out, the song soars,    continuing as the Ne are back on   the job -- getting    their papers, fanning across the   courtyard, into the    city beyond. It is in a fine life   as closing credits    roll until we --
